trans-unit.source: How to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management
trans-unit.target: How to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management
trans-unit.target: How to protect a Web API backend with Azure Active Directory and API Management

trans-unit.source: The following video shows how to build a Web API backend and protect it using OAuth 2.0 protocol with Azure Active Directory and API Management.
trans-unit.target: The following video shows how to build a Web API backend and protect it using OAuth 2.0 protocol with Azure Active Directory and API Management.

trans-unit.source: This article provides an overview and additional information for the steps in the video.
trans-unit.target: This article provides an overview and additional information for the steps in the video.

trans-unit.source: This 24 minute video shows you how to:
trans-unit.target: This 24 minute video shows you how to:

trans-unit.source: Build a Web API backend and secure it with AAD - starting at 1:30
trans-unit.target: Build a Web API backend and secure it with AAD - starting at 1:30

trans-unit.source: Import the API into API Management - starting at 7:10
trans-unit.target: Import the API into API Management - starting at 7:10

trans-unit.source: Configure the Developer portal to call the API - starting at 9:09
trans-unit.target: Configure the Developer portal to call the API - starting at 9:09

trans-unit.source: Configure a desktop application to call the API - starting at 18:08
trans-unit.target: Configure a desktop application to call the API - starting at 18:08

trans-unit.source: Configure a JWT validation policy to pre-authorize requests - starting at 20:47
trans-unit.target: Configure a JWT validation policy to pre-authorize requests - starting at 20:47

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure AD directory
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure AD directory

trans-unit.source: To secure your Web API backed using Azure Active Directory you must first have a an AAD tenant.
trans-unit.target: To secure your Web API backed using Azure Active Directory you must first have a an AAD tenant.

trans-unit.source: In this video a tenant named APIMDemo is used.
trans-unit.target: In this video a tenant named APIMDemo is used.

trans-unit.source: To create an AAD tenant, sign-in to the Azure portal and click New->App Services->Active Directory->Directory->Custom Create.
trans-unit.target: To create an AAD tenant, sign-in to the Azure portal and click New->App Services->Active Directory->Directory->Custom Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this example a directory named APIMDemo is created with a default domain named DemoAPIM.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: In this example a directory named APIMDemo is created with a default domain named DemoAPIM.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: This directory is used throughout the video.
trans-unit.target: This directory is used throughout the video.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a Web API service secured by Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Create a Web API service secured by Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: In this step, a Web API backend is created using Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: In this step, a Web API backend is created using Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: This step of the video starts at 1:30.
trans-unit.target: This step of the video starts at 1:30.

trans-unit.source: To create Web API backend project in Visual Studio click File->New->Project, and choose ASP.NET Web Application from the Web templates list.
trans-unit.target: To create Web API backend project in Visual Studio click File->New->Project, and choose ASP.NET Web Application from the Web templates list.

trans-unit.source: In this video the project is named APIMAADDemo.
trans-unit.target: In this video the project is named APIMAADDemo.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to create the project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Web API from the Select a template list to create a Web API project.
trans-unit.target: Click Web API from the Select a template list to create a Web API project.

trans-unit.source: To configure Azure Directory Authentication click Change Authentication.
trans-unit.target: To configure Azure Directory Authentication click Change Authentication.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Organizational Accounts, and specify the Domain of your AAD tenant.
trans-unit.target: Click Organizational Accounts, and specify the Domain of your AAD tenant.

trans-unit.source: In this example the domain is DemoAPIM.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: In this example the domain is DemoAPIM.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: The domain of your directory can be obtained from the Domains tab of your directory.
trans-unit.target: The domain of your directory can be obtained from the Domains tab of your directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Domains</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Domains</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configure the desired settings in the Change Authentication dialog box and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Configure the desired settings in the Change Authentication dialog box and click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Change authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Change authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you click OK Visual Studio will attempt to register your application with your Azure AD directory and you may be prompted to sign in by Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: When you click OK Visual Studio will attempt to register your application with your Azure AD directory and you may be prompted to sign in by Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Sign in using an administrative account for your directory.
trans-unit.target: Sign in using an administrative account for your directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign in to Visual Studio</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign in to Visual Studio</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure this project as an Azure Web API check the box for Host in the cloud and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: To configure this project as an Azure Web API check the box for Host in the cloud and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted to sign in to Azure, and then you can configure the Web App.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted to sign in to Azure, and then you can configure the Web App.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In this example a new App Service plan named APIMAADDemo is specified.
trans-unit.target: In this example a new App Service plan named APIMAADDemo is specified.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to configure the Web App and create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to configure the Web App and create the project.

trans-unit.source: Add the code to the Web API project
trans-unit.target: Add the code to the Web API project

trans-unit.source: The next step in the video adds the code to the Web API project.
trans-unit.target: The next step in the video adds the code to the Web API project.

trans-unit.source: This step starts at 4:35.
trans-unit.target: This step starts at 4:35.

trans-unit.source: The Web API in this example implements a basic calculator service using a model and a controller.
trans-unit.target: The Web API in this example implements a basic calculator service using a model and a controller.

trans-unit.source: To add the model for the service, right-click Models in Solution Explorer and choose Add, Class.
trans-unit.target: To add the model for the service, right-click Models in Solution Explorer and choose Add, Class.

trans-unit.source: Name the class CalcInput and click Add.
trans-unit.target: Name the class CalcInput and click Add.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statement to the top of the CalcInput.cs file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statement to the top of the CalcInput.cs file.

trans-unit.source: Replace the generated class with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Replace the generated class with the following code.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Controllers in Solution Explorer and choose Add->Controller.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Controllers in Solution Explorer and choose Add->Controller.

trans-unit.source: Choose Web API 2 Controller - Empty and click Add.
trans-unit.target: Choose Web API 2 Controller - Empty and click Add.

trans-unit.source: Type CalcController for the Controller name and click Add.
trans-unit.target: Type CalcController for the Controller name and click Add.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Controller</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Controller</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statement to the top of the CalcController.cs file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statement to the top of the CalcController.cs file.

trans-unit.source: Replace the generated controller class with the following code.
trans-unit.target: Replace the generated controller class with the following code.

trans-unit.source: This code implements the Add, Subtract, Multiply, and Divide operations of the Basic Calculator API.
trans-unit.target: This code implements the Add, Subtract, Multiply, and Divide operations of the Basic Calculator API.

trans-unit.source: Press F6 to build and verify the solution.
trans-unit.target: Press F6 to build and verify the solution.

trans-unit.source: Publish the project to Azure
trans-unit.target: Publish the project to Azure

trans-unit.source: In this step the Visual Studio project is published to Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this step the Visual Studio project is published to Azure.

trans-unit.source: This step of the video starts at 5:45.
trans-unit.target: This step of the video starts at 5:45.

trans-unit.source: To publish the project to Azure, right-click the APIMAADDemo project in Visual Studio and choose Publish.
trans-unit.target: To publish the project to Azure, right-click the APIMAADDemo project in Visual Studio and choose Publish.

trans-unit.source: Keep the default settings in the Publish Web dialog box and click Publish.
trans-unit.target: Keep the default settings in the Publish Web dialog box and click Publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Web Publish</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Web Publish</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Grant permissions to the Azure AD backend service application
trans-unit.target: Grant permissions to the Azure AD backend service application

trans-unit.source: A new application for the backend service is created in your Azure AD directory as part of the configuring and publishing process of your Web API project.
trans-unit.target: A new application for the backend service is created in your Azure AD directory as part of the configuring and publishing process of your Web API project.

trans-unit.source: In this step of the video, starting at 6:13, permissions are granted to the Web API backend.
trans-unit.target: In this step of the video, starting at 6:13, permissions are granted to the Web API backend.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the name of the application to configure the required permissions.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of the application to configure the required permissions.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Configure tab and scroll down to the permissions to other applications section.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Configure tab and scroll down to the permissions to other applications section.

trans-unit.source: Click the Application Permissions drop-down beside Windows Azure Active Directory, check the box for Read directory data, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Application Permissions drop-down beside Windows Azure Active Directory, check the box for Read directory data, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If Windows Azure Active Directory is not listed under permissions to other applications, click Add application and add it from the list.
trans-unit.target: If Windows Azure Active Directory is not listed under permissions to other applications, click Add application and add it from the list.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the App Id URI for use in a subsequent step when an Azure AD application is configured for the API Management developer portal.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the App Id URI for use in a subsequent step when an Azure AD application is configured for the API Management developer portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>App Id URI</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>App Id URI</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Import the Web API into API Management
trans-unit.target: Import the Web API into API Management

trans-unit.source: APIs are configured from the API publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: APIs are configured from the API publisher portal, which is accessed through the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To reach the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To reach the publisher portal, click Manage in the Azure Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Manage your first API[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see <link><linkText>Create an API Management service instance[]</linkText><title></title></link> in the <link><linkText>Manage your first API[]</linkText><title></title></link> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publisher portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Operations can be <link><linkText>added to APIs manually</linkText><title></title></link>, or they can be imported.
trans-unit.target: Operations can be <link><linkText>added to APIs manually</linkText><title></title></link>, or they can be imported.

trans-unit.source: In this video, operations are imported in Swagger format starting at 6:40.
trans-unit.target: In this video, operations are imported in Swagger format starting at 6:40.

trans-unit.source: Create a file named calcapi.json with following contents and save it to your computer.
trans-unit.target: Create a file named calcapi.json with following contents and save it to your computer.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the host attribute points to your Web API backend.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the host attribute points to your Web API backend.

trans-unit.source: In this example "host": "apimaaddemo.azurewebsites.net" is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example "host": "apimaaddemo.azurewebsites.net" is used.

trans-unit.source: To import the calculator API, click APIs from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Import API.
trans-unit.target: To import the calculator API, click APIs from the API Management menu on the left, and then click Import API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Import API button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Import API button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to configure the calculator API.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to configure the calculator API.

trans-unit.source: Click From file, browse to the calculator.json file you saved, and click the Swagger radio button.
trans-unit.target: Click From file, browse to the calculator.json file you saved, and click the Swagger radio button.

trans-unit.source: Type calc into the Web API URL suffix textbox.
trans-unit.target: Type calc into the Web API URL suffix textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click in the Products (optional) box and choose Starter.
trans-unit.target: Click in the Products (optional) box and choose Starter.

trans-unit.source: Click Save to import the API.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to import the API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add new API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add new API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the API is imported, the summary page for the API is displayed in the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Once the API is imported, the summary page for the API is displayed in the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: Call the API unsuccessfully from the developer portal
trans-unit.target: Call the API unsuccessfully from the developer portal

trans-unit.source: At this point, the API has been imported into API Management, but cannot yet be called successfully from the developer portal because the backend service is protected with Azure AD authentication.
trans-unit.target: At this point, the API has been imported into API Management, but cannot yet be called successfully from the developer portal because the backend service is protected with Azure AD authentication.

trans-unit.source: This is demonstrated in the video starting at 7:40 using the following steps.
trans-unit.target: This is demonstrated in the video starting at 7:40 using the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Click Developer portal from the top-right side of the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Click Developer portal from the top-right side of the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click APIs and click the Calculator API.
trans-unit.target: Click APIs and click the Calculator API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Developer portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Try it.
trans-unit.target: Click Try it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Try it</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Try it</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Send and note the response status of 401 Unauthorized.
trans-unit.target: Click Send and note the response status of 401 Unauthorized.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Send</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Send</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The request is unauthorized because the backend API is protected by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: The request is unauthorized because the backend API is protected by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Before successfully calling the API the developer portal must be configured to authorize developers using OAuth 2.0.
trans-unit.target: Before successfully calling the API the developer portal must be configured to authorize developers using OAuth 2.0.

trans-unit.source: This process is described in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: This process is described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Register the developer portal as an AAD application
trans-unit.target: Register the developer portal as an AAD application

trans-unit.source: The first step in configuring the developer portal to authorize developers using OAuth 2.0 is to register the developer portal as an AAD application.
trans-unit.target: The first step in configuring the developer portal to authorize developers using OAuth 2.0 is to register the developer portal as an AAD application.

trans-unit.source: This is demonstrated starting at 8:27 in the video.
trans-unit.target: This is demonstrated starting at 8:27 in the video.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Azure AD tenant from the first step of this video, in this example APIMDemo and navigate to the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Azure AD tenant from the first step of this video, in this example APIMDemo and navigate to the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Add button to create a new Azure Active Directory application, and choose Add an application my organization is developing.
trans-unit.target: Click the Add button to create a new Azure Active Directory application, and choose Add an application my organization is developing.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Choose Web application and/or Web API, enter a name, and click the next arrow.
trans-unit.target: Choose Web application and/or Web API, enter a name, and click the next arrow.

trans-unit.source: In this example APIMDeveloperPortal is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example APIMDeveloperPortal is used.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Sign-on URL enter the URL of your API Management service and append /signin.
trans-unit.target: For Sign-on URL enter the URL of your API Management service and append /signin.

trans-unit.source: In this example *https://contoso5.portal.azure-api.net/signin *is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example *https://contoso5.portal.azure-api.net/signin *is used.

trans-unit.source: For App Id URL enter the URL of your API Management service and append some unique characters.
trans-unit.target: For App Id URL enter the URL of your API Management service and append some unique characters.

trans-unit.source: These can be any desired characters and in this example https://contoso5.portal.azure-api.net/dp is used.
trans-unit.target: These can be any desired characters and in this example https://contoso5.portal.azure-api.net/dp is used.

trans-unit.source: When the desired App properties are configured, click the check mark to create the application.
trans-unit.target: When the desired App properties are configured, click the check mark to create the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configure an API Management OAuth 2.0 authorization server
trans-unit.target: Configure an API Management OAuth 2.0 authorization server

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure an OAuth 2.0 authorization server in API Management.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure an OAuth 2.0 authorization server in API Management.

trans-unit.source: This step is demonstrated in the video starting at 9:43.
trans-unit.target: This step is demonstrated in the video starting at 9:43.

trans-unit.source: Click Security from the API Management menu on the left, click OAuth 2.0, and then click Add authorization server.
trans-unit.target: Click Security from the API Management menu on the left, click OAuth 2.0, and then click Add authorization server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a name and an optional description in the Name and Description fields.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name and an optional description in the Name and Description fields.

trans-unit.source: These fields are used to identify the OAuth 2.0 authorization server within the API Management service instance.
trans-unit.target: These fields are used to identify the OAuth 2.0 authorization server within the API Management service instance.

trans-unit.source: In this example Authorization server demo is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example Authorization server demo is used.

trans-unit.source: Later when you specify an OAuth 2.0 server to be used for authentication for an API, you will select this name.
trans-unit.target: Later when you specify an OAuth 2.0 server to be used for authentication for an API, you will select this name.

trans-unit.source: For the Client registration page URL enter a placeholder value such as http://localhost.
trans-unit.target: For the Client registration page URL enter a placeholder value such as http://localhost.

trans-unit.source: The Client registration page URL points to the page that users can use to create and configure their own accounts for OAuth 2.0 providers that support user management of accounts.
trans-unit.target: The Client registration page URL points to the page that users can use to create and configure their own accounts for OAuth 2.0 providers that support user management of accounts.

trans-unit.source: In this example users do not create and configure their own accounts so a placeholder is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example users do not create and configure their own accounts so a placeholder is used.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, specify Authorization endpoint URL and Token endpoint URL.
trans-unit.target: Next, specify Authorization endpoint URL and Token endpoint URL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: These values can be retrieved from the App Endpoints page of the AAD application you created for the developer portal.
trans-unit.target: These values can be retrieved from the App Endpoints page of the AAD application you created for the developer portal.

trans-unit.source: To access the endpoints navigate to the Configure tab for the AAD application and click View endpoints.
trans-unit.target: To access the endpoints navigate to the Configure tab for the AAD application and click View endpoints.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>View endpoints</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>View endpoints</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint and paste it into the Authorization endpoint URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the OAuth 2.0 authorization endpoint and paste it into the Authorization endpoint URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the OAuth 2.0 token endpoint and paste it into the Token endpoint URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the OAuth 2.0 token endpoint and paste it into the Token endpoint URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In addition to pasting in the token endpoint, add an additional body parameter named resource and for the value use the App Id URI from the AAD application for the backend service that was created when the Visual Studio project was published.
trans-unit.target: In addition to pasting in the token endpoint, add an additional body parameter named resource and for the value use the App Id URI from the AAD application for the backend service that was created when the Visual Studio project was published.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>App Id URI</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>App Id URI</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next, specify the client credentials.
trans-unit.target: Next, specify the client credentials.

trans-unit.source: These are the credentials for the resource you want to access, in this case the backend service.
trans-unit.target: These are the credentials for the resource you want to access, in this case the backend service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client credentials</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client credentials</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To get the Client Id, navigate to the Configure tab of the AAD application for the backend service and copy the Client Id.
trans-unit.target: To get the Client Id, navigate to the Configure tab of the AAD application for the backend service and copy the Client Id.

trans-unit.source: To get the Client Secret click the Select duration drop-down in the Keys section and specify an interval.
trans-unit.target: To get the Client Secret click the Select duration drop-down in the Keys section and specify an interval.

trans-unit.source: In this example 1 year is used.
trans-unit.target: In this example 1 year is used.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client ID</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client ID</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Save to save the configuration and display the key.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to save the configuration and display the key.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of this key.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of this key.

trans-unit.source: Once you close the Azure Active Directory configuration window, the key cannot be displayed again.
trans-unit.target: Once you close the Azure Active Directory configuration window, the key cannot be displayed again.

trans-unit.source: Copy the key to the clipboard, switch back to the publisher portal, paste the key into the Client Secret textbox, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Copy the key to the clipboard, switch back to the publisher portal, paste the key into the Client Secret textbox, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add authorization server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Immediately following the client credentials is an authorization code grant.
trans-unit.target: Immediately following the client credentials is an authorization code grant.

trans-unit.source: Copy this authorization code and switch back to your Azure AD developer portal application configure page, and paste the authorization grant into the Reply URL field, and click Save again.
trans-unit.target: Copy this authorization code and switch back to your Azure AD developer portal application configure page, and paste the authorization grant into the Reply URL field, and click Save again.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Reply URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Reply URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The next step is to configure the permissions for the developer portal AAD application.
trans-unit.target: The next step is to configure the permissions for the developer portal AAD application.

trans-unit.source: Click Application Permissions and check the box for Read directory data.
trans-unit.target: Click Application Permissions and check the box for Read directory data.

trans-unit.source: Click Save to save this change, and then click Add application.
trans-unit.target: Click Save to save this change, and then click Add application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the search icon, type APIM into the Starting with box, select APIMAADDemo, and click the check mark to save.
trans-unit.target: Click the search icon, type APIM into the Starting with box, select APIMAADDemo, and click the check mark to save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Delegated Permissions for APIMAADDemo and check the box for Access APIMAADDemo, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Delegated Permissions for APIMAADDemo and check the box for Access APIMAADDemo, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: This allows the developer portal application to access the backend service.
trans-unit.target: This allows the developer portal application to access the backend service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enable OAuth 2.0 user authorization for the Calculator API
trans-unit.target: Enable OAuth 2.0 user authorization for the Calculator API

trans-unit.source: Now that the OAuth 2.0 server is configured, you can specify it in the security settings for your API.
trans-unit.target: Now that the OAuth 2.0 server is configured, you can specify it in the security settings for your API.

trans-unit.source: This step is demonstrated in the video starting at 14:30.
trans-unit.target: This step is demonstrated in the video starting at 14:30.

trans-unit.source: Click APIs in the left menu, and click Calculator to view and configure its settings.
trans-unit.target: Click APIs in the left menu, and click Calculator to view and configure its settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Security tab, check the OAuth 2.0 checkbox, select the desired authorization server from the Authorization server drop-down, and click Save.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Security tab, check the OAuth 2.0 checkbox, select the desired authorization server from the Authorization server drop-down, and click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Successfully call the Calculator API from the developer portal
trans-unit.target: Successfully call the Calculator API from the developer portal

trans-unit.source: Now that the OAuth 2.0 authorization is configured on the API, its operations can be successfully called from the developer center.
trans-unit.target: Now that the OAuth 2.0 authorization is configured on the API, its operations can be successfully called from the developer center.

trans-unit.source: THis step is demonstrated in the video starting at 15:00.
trans-unit.target: THis step is demonstrated in the video starting at 15:00.

trans-unit.source: Navigate back to the Add two integers operation of the calculator service in the developer portal and click Try it.
trans-unit.target: Navigate back to the Add two integers operation of the calculator service in the developer portal and click Try it.

trans-unit.source: Note the new item in the Authorization section corresponding to the authorization server you just added.
trans-unit.target: Note the new item in the Authorization section corresponding to the authorization server you just added.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Authorization code from the authorization drop-down list and enter the credentials of the account to use.
trans-unit.target: Select Authorization code from the authorization drop-down list and enter the credentials of the account to use.

trans-unit.source: If you are already signed in with the account you may not be prompted.
trans-unit.target: If you are already signed in with the account you may not be prompted.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Send and note the Response status of 200 OK and the results of the operation in the response content.
trans-unit.target: Click Send and note the Response status of 200 OK and the results of the operation in the response content.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Calculator API</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configure a desktop application to call the API
trans-unit.target: Configure a desktop application to call the API

trans-unit.source: The next procedure in the video starts at 16:30 and configures a simple desktop application to call the API.
trans-unit.target: The next procedure in the video starts at 16:30 and configures a simple desktop application to call the API.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to register the desktop application in Azure AD and give it access to the directory and to the backend service.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to register the desktop application in Azure AD and give it access to the directory and to the backend service.

trans-unit.source: At 18:25 there is a demonstration of the desktop application calling an operation on the calculator API.
trans-unit.target: At 18:25 there is a demonstration of the desktop application calling an operation on the calculator API.

trans-unit.source: Configure a JWT validation policy to pre-authorize requests
trans-unit.target: Configure a JWT validation policy to pre-authorize requests

trans-unit.source: The final procedure in the video starts at 20:48 and shows you how to use the <link><linkText>Validate JWT</linkText><title></title></link> policy to pre-authorize requests by validating the access tokens of each incoming request.
trans-unit.target: The final procedure in the video starts at 20:48 and shows you how to use the <link><linkText>Validate JWT</linkText><title></title></link> policy to pre-authorize requests by validating the access tokens of each incoming request.

trans-unit.source: If the request is not validated by the Validate JWT policy, the request is blocked by API Management and is not passed along to the backend.
trans-unit.target: If the request is not validated by the Validate JWT policy, the request is blocked by API Management and is not passed along to the backend.

trans-unit.source: For another demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <link><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title></link> and fast-forward to 13:50.
trans-unit.target: For another demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <link><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features</linkText><title></title></link> and fast-forward to 13:50.

trans-unit.source: Fast forward to 15:00 to see the policies configured in the policy editor and then to 18:50 for a demonstration of calling an operation from the developer portal both with and without the required authorization token.
trans-unit.target: Fast forward to 15:00 to see the policies configured in the policy editor and then to 18:50 for a demonstration of calling an operation from the developer portal both with and without the required authorization token.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Check out more <link><linkText>videos</linkText><title></title></link> about API Management.
trans-unit.target: Check out more <link><linkText>videos</linkText><title></title></link> about API Management.

trans-unit.source: For other ways to secure your backend service, see <link><linkText>Mutual Certificate authentication</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Connect via VPN or ExpressRoute</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For other ways to secure your backend service, see <link><linkText>Mutual Certificate authentication</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Connect via VPN or ExpressRoute</linkText><title></title></link>.
